title: If Yasuo is a permabanned champion, why not just change something about him ?!
body: If Riot doesn't want him to become permabanned maybe the best solution would be ~~gutting the shit out of him~~ changing his kit entirely, like removing his double crit chance passive. there is definitely a reason why no one wants to see him in the rift

his windwall is arguably the most wanted change for him but it is a core part of his kit.  It can not be removed without redesigning Yasuo from the ground up all the way down to his concept sketches.  If you change it into a damage ability, it is then a balance nightmare as he may have more power than intended or lose too much that his kit depends upon and become a very risky champion to play

Riot knows there are problems, but Yasuo is not a champion easily fixed

There's a shit ton of windwall tweaks one could try at least.

Give it a certain number of blocked attacks, make it like Braums with one full block and then reduced damage, make it just reduce damage, make it a placeable shield blocking a certain amount of damage, anything that gives more counterplay than wait for it to end as it's so wide that most ranged can't reposition easily without closing in on Yas.

What's annoying is his completely unlimited and unrestricted dashes. He's stupidly annoying to land skill shots on. And while some mobility is intentional, this becomes stupidly frustrating in large fights and/or with large minion waves. Take Ahri, for comparison, who's ultimate is 3 dashes. That's her **ultimate**. My worst memories of yasuo aren't necessarily ones where he hypercarries (plenty of champs do that) but where this mobility made my champion feel completely useless. As a nautilus support, I couldnt even hope to land my hook, and I've been in games where after casting my R on him, he moves quickly enough to kill my whole team before the spell even lands.

No champ should be able to completely ignore such a massive part of so many other champions' kits like that.

I'm not even going to pretend I'm going to align with the boards here: 

> What's annoying is his completely unlimited and unrestricted dashes.

They're unrestricted? Really? What about the mention of 
> large fights and/or large minion waves

That doesn't sound unrestricted to me at all. Then you compare it to Ahri's ult, 
> Take Ahri, for comparison, whose ultimate is 3 dashes. That's her **ultimate**.

Yes, and her ult is legitimately 3 unrestricted dashes in short order on a kiting mage than can do damage to 1-3 targets per dash for more damage than Yasuo's dash, and doesn't require her to be on her enemy's face. You're talking two distinctly different abilities on two different champions with distinctly different playstyles. 

> I've been in games where after casting my R on him, he moves quickly enough to kill my whole team before the spell even lands.

I don't even know what to say about this one unless you have actual evidence to back this one up or else I'm just going to dismiss it as hyperbole and move on. 

You can dislike Yasuo (god knows I do), but you don't need to lie in the process and make faulty comparisons with other champions.

Yasuo's double crit passive isnt the reason people don't like him...

- Yasuo is a popular champion, especially on release. So getting to play him at all was difficult. (frustration begins)

Heimmerdinger is way more frustrating in lane than Yasuo imho. But no one wants him permabanned... (cuz he isnt as popular? my guess)

Memory bias is self disproving: If the enemy Yasuo always carries, than Yasuo would always carry because he is always someones enemy. If teammate Yasuo always feeds... you get the point.

His kit works together to make him playable. The only part of his kit that I would call "extra" or "unneeded" is his ult placing him outside of tower range, regardless of his position to the target. It should always be in melee range of a target affected, outside of tower IF POSSIBLE. If the target is standing almost right next the turret itself, he should risk the dive like any other champion.
